subject: Climate & Environment
title: Who Runs Out of Water
description: Learn Who Runs Out of Water in one minute.

hook.text: About 2 billion people live in countries facing high water stress right now.

buildup.text: Water stress means demand is approaching or exceeding the available supply.

discovery.text: The Middle East and North Africa use over 80% of available freshwater every year.

twist.text: By 2025, half the world's population could be living in water-stressed areas.

climax.text: Water scarcity is not always about rainfall â€” it is often about mismanagement and waste.

punchline.text: Running out of water is not a future problem. It's a current one.

quiz.question: How many people currently live in water-stressed countries?
